intro: Euphrasia borealis, commonly known as the northern eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats. Euphrasia borealis is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes several parasitic and non-parasitic species. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
